title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 2399.3 - Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 2399.3 - Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 171, 289-d(3), 434-a(3), 514-a(2), 691(c), 1091(c), 1147(a)(3), 1419(c)

Except as otherwise provided by law or this Title, when the
last day prescribed (including any extensions of time, where applicable) for
filing a document, making a payment, or performing any act falls on a Saturday, Sunday or a day which is a legal holiday in the State of New York, these acts
will be considered timely if performed on the next succeeding day which is not
a Saturday, Sunday or legal holiday. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§
2399.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
